sentences.en: Compulsion will never result in convincing them.
sentences.cn: 强迫永远不会使他们信服.

sentences.en: Harry says Archambault has a compulsion to write things.
sentences.cn: 哈里说阿香博有写作的冲动.

sentences.en: He felt a sudden compulsion to drop the bucket and run.
sentences.cn: 他突然有一种想扔掉水桶撒腿就跑的冲动。

sentences.en: He felt an inner compulsion to write.
sentences.cn: 他感到內心有一种写作的强烈欲望.

sentences.en: He seemed drived by some mad compulsion.
sentences.cn: 他似乎受到某种疯狂的冲动所驱使.

sentences.en: I refuse to act under compulsion, ie because I am forced to.
sentences.cn: 我决不能让人逼着做事.

sentences.en: I will pay nothing under compulsion.
sentences.cn: 在强迫之下我分文也不愿付.

sentences.en: It's a compulsion to write, more than talent, that makes a writer.
sentences.cn: 成为作家要有天分，但更要有创作的冲动。

sentences.en: John will take his medicine only by compulsion.
sentences.cn: 只有对他用强制手段约翰才会服药.

sentences.en: Many universities argued that students learned more when they were in classes out of choice rather than compulsion.
sentences.cn: 很多大学认为如果学生上课是出于自愿而不是被迫，那么他们学到的东西会更多。

sentences.en: Physical compulsion or restraint was effectual, of course, while it lasted.
sentences.cn: 当然, 体罚和管束在施行的当时还是有效的.

sentences.en: She felt a sudden compulsion to hit him.
sentences.cn: 她突然感到一种难以抗拒的冲动,想要揍他.

sentences.en: The desire to laugh became a compulsion.
sentences.cn: 想笑的欲望变得控制不住了。

sentences.en: The use of compulsion in psychiatric care cannot be justified.
sentences.cn: 在精神病治疗中使用强制手段是不正当的。

sentences.en: There is an element of compulsion in the new scheme for the unemployed.
sentences.cn: 新的失业方案里有一种强制因素.

sentences.en: There would be no compulsion for them to keep moving.
sentences.cn: 到这时候便是天大的力量,也赶他们不动了.

sentences.en: They made the prisoners do the work by compulsion.

words.tran_cn: 义务的；必修的；被强制的
（花样滑冰、竞技体操等的）规定动作

trans.tran_cn: 强迫，强制，冲动，打动人的力量
trans.tran_en: a strong and unreasonable desire to do something
